name: Grammarly for Developers
about:
I joined a small team of 5 to help create a shippable Web Component, a devloper hub to manage thier applicaitons and various support functions like a blog, build infrastructure, AMPScript emails all to bring Grammalry for Developers to market.

I worked on every level of the applicaiton including parts of it's backend written in Java and Scala. As we approached our "Go Live" date I created an Easter Egg (in the style of Microsoft's Windows 95 secret) to commemorate the acheivement of the incredable people who helped get our product ready.
stack: developer.grammarly.com was built entirely in Vue 3.2, the WebComponent was built in React and the app server was built in Java. There is a heavy empasis on JavaScript (and AJAX patterns) for data views (which can be seen in the screen casts). The Content Management system is a Java Web Application (written for Tomcat 7) and uses the Twitter Bootstrap CSS framework.
